metadata.title: Why Self-Service Big Data Processing is The Future | by Shafiqa Iqbal | Towards Data Science
metadata.h1: Why Self-Service Big Data Processing is The Future
metadata.description: Big data is transforming the way we make business decisions. It allows far greater insight into our future potential. It illuminates the customer journey in ways that self-reporting doesn’t reveal…

outgoing_paragraph_urls.anchor_text: no plans to invest in Hadoop

all_paragraphs: Big data is transforming the way we make business decisions. It allows far greater insight into our future potential. It illuminates the customer journey in ways that self-reporting doesn’t reveal. It cuts through all the BS to show us where our efforts are paying off or falling flat.

It’s becoming impossible to ignore big data and its business impacts. Big data is proving to be quite profitable. Millions of users are generating new data points each day, and plenty of data analysis tools have been developed to make sense of all the information. Data analytics is invaluable when analyzing market trends and policies. Forbes mentioned:
A recent big data analysis report from Dresner Advisory Services concludes that 53% of companies are adopting big data analytics.

The 2.5 quintillion bytes of data are created every day is useless unless we crunch it using big data analytics. This is where things get exciting for businesses as we can now predict market behavior with laser-focus accuracy at a personal level.

Most companies are facing a voluminous flow of information on a daily basis. The companies that will benefit most are those that manage to bring data together in a meaningful synthesis in the future. It will be a must for companies to invest in the big data processing. A combination of data synthesis and data analysis will further develop the effective use of data. It will be essential that users receive assistance in reading, working, analyzing, and communicating the data.
To achieve this, companies must specifically promote the data knowledge of their employees by using partners who offer software, training, and also support the SaaS model (Software-as-a-Service).
Why companies are going after Self-Service Big Data Processing Products?

People with the required skills such as Hadoop, Spark, Website Development, are expensive and scarce. Data from glassdoor.com shows salaries for people with Hadoop, spark and full-stack development are much higher:

While it runs on commodity hardware, Hadoop costs can add up, especially when considering the above staffing costs to set up and maintain it. For the 54% of the Gartner universe that has no plans to invest in Hadoop, finding a fully-managed SaaS big data analytics solution allows them the on-ramp to big data without the associated costs.
When evaluating, ask your solution provider the following questions:
You will be in luck if a self-service product will provide you with all these. Your cost and time will be reduced drastically, with much less management left.

If you tell me that business executives are here just to “look over” business only, I would have believed you if we were 10 years into the past. There was a time when business owners will have a vision and then it was up to the development team to shape that into reality. Nowadays business owners are setting technological trends in their companies.

Leveraging big data, business analytics and artificial intelligence (AI) to deliver solutions to complex challenges is not solely the responsibility of technology and data science specialists. Rather, it’s the responsibility of organizational leadership to understand and direct these approaches to achieve their business goals.
In 2017, John Chambers, the CEO of Cisco Systems, delivered a disquieting message to participants in Harvard Business School’s executive education program for CEOs.

“A decade or two ago, CEOs could be in their offices with spreadsheets, executing on strategy,” he said. “Now, if you’re not out listening to the market and catching market transitions, … if you’re not understanding that you need to constantly reinvent yourself every three to five years, you as a CEO will not survive.”

The latest data shows that executives have started learning about data science. They are moving towards taking business and IT into their own hands. More and more courses are being added on edX, Coursera and Udemy to help business owners take ownership of their data and draw insights from them.

With the help of basic data science skills and these readily available self-service SAAS big data processing products, business owners can reduce the implementation cost of in-house data processing development and management. They can ensure the confidentiality of their data and make decisions on their own.

In this post, we learned about the value and trends of big data, how self-service SAAS products come into the picture and why business owners should learn the latest trending big data processing tools to utilize these self-service products.
Your home for data science. A Medium publication sharing concepts, ideas and codes.
